Edited February 16, 2017 by _JebediahKerman

It's difficult to discern much detail in some of your screenshots. I find that a good way to get good images of your spacecraft is to try taking pictures from multiple angles, and also to try to get pictures of the sun-facing side (obviously this doesn't work for night-side images but if you know you'll be taking pictures in the dark it's usually good to add some lights, and also to get some light-side pics as well so people can see the detail). Your thread will attract more attention if people can see the details of your spacecraft.

Also, I see your Mun colony is experiencing some...technical difficulties. When landing on non-atmospheric bodies, it's often best to set the SAS mode to surface and to point retrograde, and decrease your surface velocity directly like a reverse gravity turn. That way, if you're landing on relatively flat land (which it appears you were), it's quite rare for your vehicle to fall over.

When landing on non-atmospheric bodies, it's often best to set the SAS mode to surface and to point retrograde, and decrease your surface velocity directly like a reverse gravity turn. That way, if you're landing on relatively flat land (which it appears you were), it's quite rare for your vehicle to fall over.

I falled over, because I landed on a mountain, and I falled down from that

Ah, that makes sense. Landing in one of the big craters is usually the best way to avoid that for the Mun.
